result.execSummary:
The defendant Christina L. Wintermote was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christina L. Wintermote is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christina L. Wintermote was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Ct. 3

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney X Solis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 1 & 2 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court imposes sentence of 2 days jail w/credit for 2 days served; costs ordered, 30 DTP or civil judgment.

With ADA Krezcarek and Atty Solis the JSH of 1/12/17 at 1:30pm is rescheduled; as Atty Solis is obtaining some mental health records for ADA Krejcarek so they can go over them together, also the State needs to discuss case w/with alleged victim SW, believes they will be able to resolve the case; reset to 2/2/17 at 10:30am.
Modified bond signed.

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Violent Contact with LMW (dob 10-16-96) *Contact w/SWW (dob 4-6-99) at his discretion but no violent contact, *No contact with BHT (dob 2-17-11) MDR (dob 3-31-05) Wendy K or any of their residences except as authorized by juvenile court.
948.03(2)(b) - Physical abuse of a child intentionally cause bodily harm - 3 cts  /  947.01(1) - DC - 2 cts

JS set for 3/13/17 at 8:30am and JSH 1/12/17 at 1:30pm.  ADA Krejcarek states the victim witness coordinator received a call from the deft's son who would like to have contact.  Court amends bond conditions to *Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Violent Contact with LMW (dob 10-16-96) *Contact w/SWW (dob 4-6-99) at his discretion but no violent contact, BHT (dob 2-17-11) MDR (dob 3-31-05) Wendy K or any of their residences except as authorized by juvenile court.

948.03(2)(b) - Physical abuse of a child intentionally cause bodily harm - 3 cts  /  947.01(1) - DC - 2 cts

Victim present.  ADA Krejcarek states the victim would like to have contact with the deft. records.addlTxt:
Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Xavier Solis and Atty Diane Caspari.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  148 - DE has decided to keep Atty Caspari on this case. Judge Meier recuses. Cases will be reset once recusal is approved and scheduled with new judge.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Attys Diane Caspari and Xavier Solis.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  905 - Atty Caspari reports she will not be able to represent DE from 8/8 - 10/8.  DE has expressed a possible interest in Atty Caspari withdrawing entirely. Matter to be set for status for decision from DE as to whether Atty Caspri will remain on 14CF85 and 14CF1231 after 10/8. SPD appointment of Atty Solis on all cases together pending DE's decision. JT will be rescheduled, as Judge Meier will likely recuse. Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm. (ps 7/22/16)

State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells.  DE appears in person with Atty Diane Caspari.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  248 - Matter heard with 14CF1231. Atty Caspari requests JT. ST has two felony bail jumping charges to be issued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Diane Caspari.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  906 - Matter heard with 14CF1231. Atty Caspari states multiple witnesses have recanted, affidavits on file with the court. As such, DE wishes to withdraw her previously entered plea. Discussion held. Court grants DE's motion, and allows DE to withdraw her pleas on both cases.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Fr: L. Wintermote re: EVID. Copy to DE atty, DA
Evidentiary hearing at 04-15-2016 09:00 am
Due to ongoing JT, EVID rescheduled to 4/15 @ 9am. Attorneys notified by phone, and NOH sent to all parties.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. No appearance by DE. Atty Caspari appears by phone.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 1014 - Matter heard with 14CF1231. Case is scheduled for 2pm, but due to Atty Caspari's unavailability, EVID is rescheduled. Atty Caspari is to contact DE to let her know of the scheduling change. Subpoena continued for witness that appeared today to new EVID date.  Evidentiary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Diane Caspari.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Discussion held regarding pending defense motions.  Atty Caspari withdraws her motion to remove Atty Tracey Braun as prosecutor.  Atty Caspari indicates she will subpoena Atty Braun for the evidentiary hearing on the motion to withdraw plea, to be heard on 12/7/15 at 2:00.  Atty Caspari ordered to serve subpoena on Atty Braun by 11/13/15.  Bond continued.
Due to the court's calendar, 8/27/2015 Motion hearing is rescheduled to 10/28/2015 at 8:30am.  Parties notified in court.
6/11/15 - Status Hearing
The petition is DENIED because this is a criminal case & the petitioner is the defendant in this case.    (Copy sent to DE on 7/28/2015)

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:09am-  Matter heard with 14CF1231.  Victim rights compliance.  DE requests ADA Braun be removed as prosecutor for this case.
